reviewText: another one of my husbands favorite
An excellent movie to have in your movie collection. Children and adults will love it.

and with this dvd, we got 2 great dog movies. I buy animal movies for the youngsters in our family, so they can
grow up loving animals, and learning to live with them.

I haven't watch a dog of flanders yet but I will. I love sounder and this heartwarming tale of a family who trying to make through the depressing time. I bought the set at walmart for 3bucks. A steal. It's worth it.

May be an old movie but was asked by 10yr.old granddaughter if would get for her,she has watched it over & over,so glad are still able to get the oldies & that my grandkids enjoy them as much as I did. Thanks Amazon

I don't care how old your kids are, these two are worth watching. Sounder is a classic and both movies are not only very entertaining but inlike most of todays movies they teach us what integrity, loyalty and functional versus dysfunctional lives look like. These are worth buying and not just renting!

While it does not say so anywhere on the back of the case, and this contradicts Amazon's description, the double feature disk of Sounder and A Dog Of Flanders are both widescreen releases. They are not anamorphic so you have to zoom your screen to fill it up unless you have an old tube, but I don't find that to be a big problem. It's double-sided, one disk. FYI for anyone who has wondered.
One of my favorite movies.  Packaged as expected.
Sounder is superb and worth the price by itself. A Dog of Flanders is just a throw-in.

I bought this dvd as a gift for a 6th grade young man.
He told me both stories/movies were great.
It arrived safely and on time.

A Double Feature:  "Sounder" and "A Dog of Flanders".  Two movies produced by Robert B. Ratnits, well known for making movies the whole family will enjoy.  Two movies in which the title role goes to the featured dogs.  Two dogs, both trained by Frank T. Weatherwax.  You may recognize the flop eared dog in "A Dog of Flanders" from his former title role in Disney's "Old Yeller".
